perturbation.original_text: The Association is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of New York ("FHLBNY"); and the deposit accounts of the Association are insured by the FDIC up to the applicable limits. Upon consummation of the Conversion, the liquidation account for the benefit of Eligible Account Holders and Supplemental Eligible Account Holders will be duly established in accordance with the requirements of the Conversion Regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: The Association is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of New York ("FHLBNY"). Upon consummation of the Conversion, the liquidation account for the benefit of Eligible Account Holders and Supplemental Eligible Account Holders will be duly established in accordance with the requirements of the Conversion Regulations.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause 'the deposit accounts of the Association are insured by the FDIC up to the applicable limits' omits a crucial consumer protection detail required by federal law for savings and loan associations. This creates a legal contradiction by failing to disclose deposit insurance.
perturbation.law_explanation: This modification omits the legally required disclosure that deposit accounts are insured by the FDIC, potentially misleading depositors about the safety of their funds.

perturbation.original_text: The Company shall register its Common Stock under Section 12(g) of the 1934 Act concurrent with the stock offering pursuant to the Plan and shall request that such registration be effective upon completion of the Conversion. The Company shall maintain the effectiveness of such registration for not less than three years or such shorter period as permitted by the OTS.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company shall register its Common Stock under Section 12(g) of the 1934 Act concurrent with the stock offering pursuant to the Plan and shall request that such registration be effective upon completion of the Conversion.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause 'The Company shall maintain the effectiveness of such registration for not less than three years or such shorter period as permitted by the OTS' eliminates a guarantee to maintain registration and provide transparency, which contradicts consumer protection principles embedded in securities laws.
perturbation.law_explanation: This modification omits the requirement to maintain the effectiveness of the registration of its common stock, potentially reducing transparency and investor protection as envisioned by the Securities Exchange Act.

perturbation.original_text: During the period during which the Company's common stock is registered under the 1934 Act or for three years from the date hereof, whichever period is greater, the Company will furnish to its stockholders as soon as practicable after the end of each fiscal year an annual report (including a balance sheet and statements of income, stockholders' equity and changes in financial position or cash flow statement of the Company as at the end of and for such year, certified by independent public accountants and prepared in accordance with Regulation S-X under the 1934 Act).
perturbation.changed_text: During the period during which the Company's common stock is registered under the 1934 Act or for three years from the date hereof, whichever period is greater, the Company will furnish to its stockholders as soon as practicable after the end of each fiscal year an annual report (including a balance sheet and statements of income, stockholders' equity and changes in financial position or cash flow statement of the Company as at the end of and for such year).
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'certified by independent public accountants and prepared in accordance with Regulation S-X under the 1934 Act' this weakens the requirement to provide independently audited financial reports to stockholders as mandated by securities regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Regulation S-X
perturbation.law_explanation: This modification weakens investor protection by omitting the requirement for certified financial statements prepared according to Regulation S-X, which dictates the form and content of financial statements filed with the SEC, thus reducing the reliability and transparency of the reports.
